title: DATALAD_SSH_IDENTITYFILE is not in effect for git-annex !?

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
NB sorry if not totally descriptive but spent too much time digging all the way down from reproman and trying to figure out.  Want to just record what I found, pardon my mistakes in the following claim, if there is any:

For remote hosts reachable only via a dedicated ssh key, we have come up with DATALAD_SSH_IDENTITYFILE (config) to point to such ssh key.   I believe it worked nicely for both git and git-annex, but I believe we do not have (or was it somehow gone?) a nice dedicated test for that and it stopped working!

Here is demonstration on the laptop (watchout -- removes authorized_keys):

```
#!/bin/bash

export PS4='> '

set -eu

cd "$(mktemp -d ${TMPDIR:-/tmp}/dl-ssh-XXXXXXX)"

ssh-add -D || :
rm -f ~/.ssh/authorized_keys

ssh-keygen -f identity -N ''
cat identity.pub >| ~/.ssh/authorized_keys

datalad create test1; touch test1/data; datalad save -d test1

# this will go ok
DATALAD_SSH_IDENTITYFILE=$PWD/identity datalad clone localhost:$PWD/test1 test1-clone

# but get would demand password!
# in my specific use case password is not allowed auth method, so it just fails
DATALAD_SSH_IDENTITYFILE=$PWD/identity datalad get -d test1-clone
```

Some observations:

- `sshconnector` makes use of that variable to include in minting the socket filename
- `sshconnector` does not start socket
- `git-annex` seems to not care about us setting `GIT_SSH_COMMAND="datalad sshrun" GIT_SSH_VARIANT=ssh`
  - I have tried with git-annex `7.20190819+git2-g908476a9b-1~ndall+1` and `8.20201127+git54-ga1b227171-1~ndall+1` with the same "success"
- as a result - annex cannot `get` anything :-/

To me smells like a bug in git-annex, but I bet I have tried before with that elderly 7.20190819 ... may be datalad also behaved differently (always started a socket?) back then and that is why it worked (but I have tried even 0.11.7 to the same effect).

So am I dreaming that it ever worked for git-annex?  or there is a long standing regression which we have missed?
